701944f-b.text:
University Avenue, west side just south of Burnside Avenue, showing the entrance to Embrook, according to Mr. Chrystie, the photographer. Embrook was the home of Mrs. Ludlow Dadwood, and was later the clubhouse of Berkeley Oval. This estate was owned by T. C. Eastman, according to an 1868 atlas and was Berkeley Oval in 1900 (Bromley atlas).
E. P. Chrystie  May 30, 1923
701944f-b.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue, Bronx, NY

701944f-a.text:
University Avenue, west side just south of Burnside Avenue, showing the entrance to Embrook, according to Mr. Chrystie, the photographer. Embrook was the home of Mrs. Ludlow Dadwood, and was later the clubhouse of Berkeley Oval. This estate was owned by T. C. Eastman, according to an 1868 atlas and was Berkeley Oval in 1900 (Bromley atlas).
E. P. Chrystie  May 30, 1923
701944f-a.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue, Bronx, NY

701943f-a.text:
(1)
Universitv Ave. (left, from fore to background), north from and including West Burnside Ave. In the foreground is the north side of West Burnside Ave. from University to Harrison Aves. and the old Croton Aqueduct running between the two and parallel to them.
August 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view. The two buildings on the left bear Nos. 2O01 and 2O15. North of that and seen through the trees is
Gould Hall of New York University.
August 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
701943f-a.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue (West), Bronx, NY

701943f-b.folder: University Avenue & Burnside Avenue (West), Bronx, NY

702065f.text:
W. Burnside Avenue, north side, east from University Avenue (foreground) to Harrison Avenue, showing the old Croton Adueduct at the N.E. corner of University Avenue. The Burnside Manor Building is at the N.W. corner of Harrison Avenue.
January 30, 1938
P. L. Sperr
702065f.folder: West Burnside Avenue & E. University Avenue., Bronx, NY
